div1.head: Military Record of J.F. Dunshie, by Jefferson Randolph Kean, October 23, 1901
div1.opener:
1st Endorsement.
HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF CUBA.
SUPT. DEPT. OF CHARITIES.
HAVANA: OCT. 23, 1901.
--R--
div1.p:
Respectfully returned to Dr.
J. F. Dunchie, Mobile, Ala., U.S.A.
with the statement that I was call-
ed upon by the Surgeon General for
the reasons for my recommendation
that his contract be annuled, which
I gave in full while the facts were
fresh in my mind and the data ac-
cessible. This statement I sup-
posed the Surgeon General desired
in order to furnish to Dr. Dunchie.

At present the records of the
Surgeon General Chief Surgeon's Office of the
Department of Havana and Pinar del
Rio are not accessible to me, but
the facts are, as well as I can re-
collect, that Dr. Dunchie failed to
carry out the provisions of the
Circular from the Surgeon General's Chief Surgeons
Office requiring the examination of
the urine and the routine taking of
temperature in all fever cases and
the preservation of these data in
the hospital records.

The result of this negligence
was the failure to recognize a case
of yellow fever and the consequent
infection of the hospital at that
post. As well as I can now recol-
lect, I think that there was some
evidence that the records in the
case of this man were burned by
Dr. Dunchie just before his depar-
ture from the Post. If Dr. Dunchie
desires further information on this
subject, it is suggested that he
make application to the Surgeon
General for a copy of the endorse-
ment above referred to, stating
all the facts in his case.
div1.closer:
J.R. Kean
Major & Surgeon, U.S.A.
Supt. Department of Charities. --ooOOoo--
FROM GEN. J.R. KEAN
